definition: to electrocute/to die from an electric shock
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: Don't touch that wire, you'll electrocute yourself.
sentences.chinese: 别碰那根电线，你会被电死的。

sentences.english: The Taser model will electrocute a crowd of people at the touch of a button.
sentences.chinese: 泰瑟模型将只需按一个按钮就可以电死一群人。

sentences.english: 8-6. As it happens, a razor that is safe in Europe is unlikely to electrocute Americans.
sentences.chinese: 碰巧在欧洲使用安全的剃须刀不大可能电死美国人。

sentences.english: If you don't get caught you get electrocuted.
sentences.chinese: 如果你没有被抓，那么你被电死。

definition: to leak electricity/(fig.) (coll.) to unintentionally arouse romantic interest (by being solicitous etc)/cf. 放電|放电[fang4 dian4]
to knock down and kill sb with a car/to run over sb/to run sb down
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
